text: Wondering if anyone can help me out here. I’m working on making my own mobile menu from scratch and can’t seem to get the right thing to happen when I tap the menu items that have children on mobile. In Dev Tools - it straight up just closes the instant it opens. On the phone it works - most of the time but sometimes takes a few taps to close a menu you’ve opened. I’m bad at javascript so any feedback at all is welcome.
I want to be in control of the mobile menu script because I have some specific requirements for some custom stuff going on in menus soon and can’t just use the one that HubSpot provides.
This is the menu script so far
<@UDC6ATL20>.. have you tried injecting a span or div into the parent with child li
I’m afraid I don’t understand how that would effect things - can you help me out?
Example in the wild that i did.
that looks fantastic. did you have to use two hs menu modules to accomplish the sidebar?
i cloned the parent ul into a div i injected into the body
this is great chad - thanks for the examples
Anyone know how to pass options as an argument in the  `.toLocaleDateString()` method without setting anything for the first argument?
I want to do this: `dateSubITD.toLocaleDateString({year:"2-digit"});` so that I get a two digit year.
Would it screw things up if I just set the first argument to `undefined`?
appears to work, sorry to work through and solve my problems so publicly
